item.title: The New Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I’m going to try again later today, bought the supplies back and a d pic this time, arma etc(5 hits with d pic rather than 10 with rune pic on armdilo’s). Also, don’t logout without picking up your crystals if your going to log pick them up then log. I realised this after not picking up half of them xD.
This time I’m not gonna pick up one of the mage crystals, (the first one that appears) so I can juggle less and you don’t need more than 1 if your a main. I’d probably say range crystal on mains anyways aren’t needed too(str ofc not needed), maybe use it up to speed jad.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I just tried it(died at wave 36 cause i thought it was still north safe spot, no east i didn’t watch vids). Although my Tort died at wave 27 with lots of supplies it was fairly easy to get there although long. I used blood barrage, vampirism mostly. Ice barrages and range to speed things up at times, I was doing fine hp wise, prayer was good too although I was using renewals and super prayer. I lost a lot of supplies at the armidolo’s tbh(like 5 brew flask…, failed at trapping them so mass clicked) and got my titan to kill them, it took a while but worked so don’t underestimate them. I didn’t ss much, so its not a neccesity but the higher pray prayer level helped. Ovls helped, again not a neccesity(possibly though at the boss and waves 25-28 as you need to brew then, although I’ve not tried the boss yet) but they make things a lot faster. Thats what I have learned from my first attempt, I brung karils spectral ragefires sol barrage runes etc and range broad bolts i was mostly maging so thats my knowledge from my first attempt.
Its about endurance in my opinion, I’ll probably give it another go later in total I spent about 3m-4m doing the attempt went well for a first time. I’ll give it another go properly later. I was being cautious took me about 3 hours no boss fight.

Read full topic

item.title: The New Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

tL:

I don’t play anymore, but I did always enjoy the Jad fights. So I think i’ll have a go at this soon. What is the preferred method of fighting? Is it range like the the Fight Caves?

Full combat triangle is preferred. A youtube user named Smokey9112 did a wave by wave guide using welfare gear and only a war tortoise.

YouTube

Smokey9112Films

#1 Runescape PvM Troll "A Full Yak is a Happy Yak" - Smokey9112 2010/12/16 I troll the hardest monsters in Runescape. http://puu.sh/2dm4W I used a Mac Record...

Read full topic

item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Without soul split and turmoil, it might be hard. If you did the quest for the curses, could you at least do deflect melee? What is your herblore level? Might be very hard without extremes or overloads. As for your stats, they are definitely on the low end for this game.

item.title: The New Fire Cape
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

tL:

I don’t play anymore, but I did always enjoy the Jad fights. So I think i’ll have a go at this soon. What is the preferred method of fighting? Is it range like the the Fight Caves?

Tribrid or range + mage is the way to go. Melee is good but if you want to conserve supplies you’ll only use melee on jad or situations you’ll take minimal damage as you generally have to run in the open while using it. Tribrid/Range + mage is my opinion however I haven’t tried it yet but thats what everyone seems to be doing although its possible without mage but mage is the most useful one there.

Read full topic
